title:
Growth of bulk crystals of magnetic topological insulators under
  peritectic conditions
authors:
Anton I. Sergeev, Alexander S. Frolov, Nadezhda V. Vladimirova, Arseny
  A. Naumov, Maria Kirsanova, Mark A. Naumov, Vasily S. Stolyarov, Vladimir A.
  Golyashov, Oleg E. Tereshchenko, Ilya I. Klimovskikh, Marina E. Tamm, Lada V.
  Yashina
abstract:
Magnetic topological materials (MTIs) including MnBi$_2$Te$_4$ are of
scientific interest due to the possibility to reveal the interplay between
topological and magnetic orders. For these materials preparation issues are
still challenging. In our paper we report new synthetic protocol using
two-phase source in Bridgman-like growth procedure. We applied it to grow a
number of TIs of GeAs$_2$Te$_4$ structural type including individual compounds
MnBi$_2$Te$_4$, MnSb$_2$Te$_4$, GeBi$_2$Te$_4$, SnBi$_2$Te$_4$, PbBi$_2$Te$_4$
and several mixed crystals of whole range of compositions: Mn(Bi,Sb)$_2$Te$_4$,
(Ge,Mn)Bi$_2$Te$_4$, new materials Mn(Bi,In)$_2$Te$_4$. The method developed
can be used to obtain single crystals of any incongruently melted compounds
with small region of primary crystallization from melt in the corresponding
equilibrium phase diagrams.
